intro: Bulbocodium lusitanicum, commonly known as the Portuguese bulbous bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous root system and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climate conditions. Its flowers are usually blue or violet in color, and it blooms from spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native range.
